txt.en: 'No, I suppose not. But I had no part in the death of her husband! I could have dispatched riders to go with him to the East Wall, but we are stretched thin as it is! How was I to know he would perish by the Pillars of the Kings? I cannot be blamed for that.\n\n'I do feel badly about the death of her son, but I had no choice in that. The boy should have known not to enter a sword-trial with a veteran warrior such as myself. I hope to be given the chance to cure Mildrith of her sorrows.'
